page.title: 02GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: Buildings Some of the cottages are now used as retirement homes or holiday cottages. There is one large rectory in the area near Rainsbury farm but the church that it served is now derelict. The ruined church of St. James is looked after by the "Redundant Churches Fund". It seems as though it only served the immediate area since it is very small, the nave being only about seven metres long. The area is mainly high ground, Wimbleball lake being at an altitude of about 200m, the land rising to over 300m in the east of the area. It is an area of great natural beauty, the steep banks at the side of the roads being covered with foxgloves when we were there in the summer.
